intro: Cacalia bahamensis, commonly known as the Bahamian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Bahamas. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy soils along coastal areas and is adapted to salt spray and wind. It has slender, hairy stems and produces small, greenish leaves. Cacalia bahamensis is an important component of the local flora and is often found in dune ecosystems.
